content: and forth down one side ch2 * fpdc half_double_crochet repeat from * 13 times round 8 total of 27 stitches ch2 turn your work * bpdc half_double_crochet repeat from * 13 times the last half_double_crochet is in the top of the ch2 from the previous round round 9 total of 27 stitches ch2 turn your work * fpdc half_double_crochet repeat from * 13 times the last half_double_crochet is in the top of the ch2 from the previous round rounds 10 12 14 repeat round 8 rounds 11 13 15 repeat round 9 try your cozy over your teapot at this stage it should be slightly too short you will be adding a few row of single_crochet stitches after crocheting down the other side of your teapot cozy you can add or subtract row from these side sections to suit your teapot cut your yarn when you are happy with the length of the first side and reattach it where you made the slip_stitch at the end of round 6 right next to the ch2 at the beginning of round 7 side 2 round 7 total of 27 stitches ch2 with the wrong side facing you * bpdc half_double_crochet repeat from * 13 times the last half_double_crochet is in the same stitch as the last half_double_crochet at the end of round 7 on side one side 2 round 8 total of 27 stitches ch2 turn your work * fpdc half_double_crochet repeat from * 13 times the last half_double_crochet is in the top of the ch2 from the previous round side 2 round 9 total of 27 stitches ch2 turn your work * bpdc half_double_crochet repeat from * 13 times the last half_double_crochet is in the top of the ch2 from the previous round side 2 rounds 10 12 14 repeat round 8 of side 2 side 2 rounds 11 13 15 repeat round 9 of side 2 if you are using a different yarn for the single_crochet stitches around the bottom of your cozy finish off and weave in your ends attach the new yarn joining two corners and then ch1 if you are using the same yarn to create the row of single_crochet stitches around the bottom make a slip stitch to join the next corner of the other side of the cozy and ch1 with the right side of your work facing you single_crochet into every stitch all the way round and slip_stitch into the ch1 when you get half way round you will want to insert your hook into both the corner stitches when creating a single_crochet stitch three rounds of single_crochet stitches maybe sufficient try the cozy on the teapot and adjust the number of row if necessary if your cozy is fairly tight fitting it will go on easier if you put it over the spout first my cozy has three row of single_crochet stitches around the bottom the stitch count for each single_crochet round should be 52 but it s easy to be slightly off
